   "source": [
    "# Conic Sections in Sympy, a very Brief Introduction"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 7,
   "id": "008a81f4-587d-451e-b121-68cdcf5db43b",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "import matplotlib as mp\n",
    "from sympy import symbols, Eq, plot_implicit"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 9,
   "id": "34b13114-47a7-4431-b207-39a15dd6bd15",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "x, y, a,b = symbols(\"x y a b\")\n",
    "a = 1\n",
    "b = 3"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 10,
   "id": "17fb2b58-c9e1-4aa4-bbd3-83f5255e14b0",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [],
   "source": [
    "# JCL Todo explain functions\n",
    "\n",
    "ellipse =   (y**2)/(b**2) + (x**2)/(a**2) - 1 \n",
    "hyperbola = (y**2)/(b**2) - (x**2)/(a**2) - 1 \n",
    "\n",
    "# Another way to write the function without zeroing out one side.\n",
    "hyperbola2 = Eq((y**2)/(b**2) - (x**2)/(a**2), 1)"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 12,
   "id": "777d22c2-fc39-4003-a68b-8e40e2722806",
   "metadata": {},
   "outputs": [
    {
     "data": {
      "image/png": "",
      "text/plain": [
       "<Figure size 640x480 with 1 Axes>"
      ]
     },
     "metadata": {},
     "output_type": "display_data"
    }
   ],
   "source": [
    "# Could break code out during the explanation phase and then do each separately, \n",
    "# then combine the ellipse and hyperbola\n",
    "\n",
    "%matplotlib inline\n",
    "p1 = plot_implicit(ellipse, show=False, xlabel=\"\", ylabel=\"\")\n",
    "p2 = plot_implicit(hyperbola,show=False, xlabel=\"\", ylabel=\"\")\n",
    "p1.extend(p2)\n",
    "p1.show()"
   ]
  },
  {
   "cell_type": "code",
   "execution_count": 13,
   "id": "af8c953e-7e1f-4c94-a258-43749840d3ba",

   "source": [
    "# Now do it Euclid's way\n",
    "# Note, it breaks down at  radii > 5 -- use that to introduce \n",
    "# symplot\n",
    "%matplotlib inline\n",
    "circle1 = Circle(Point(0,0), 5)\n",
    "# print(circle1.center)\n",
    "# print(circle1.radius)\n",
    "# print(circle1.equation())\n",
    "p = plot_implicit(circle1.equation(), show=False)\n",
    "p.aspect_ratio=(1,1) \n",
    "grid_max = 10\n",
    "grid_min = -10\n",
    "lims = (grid_min, grid_max)\n",
    "p.xlim = lims\n",
    "p.ylim = lims\n",
    "p.show()"
   ]
